poem:
**A Triumph for Equal Pay**

Six years of struggle,
breakfasts missed,
moments away,
shop workers' quiet voices
undercut the silent tills,
and now, a victory,
earned through time's crown.

Thirty million pounds,
a weight of fairness
crashing through
the glass shelves,
each coin
a note of justice
sung by
3,540 hearts.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Next shop workers win six-year battle for equal pay in landmark case Shop workers at Next have won a six-year legal fight for equal pay in a landmark case that could force the retailer to pay more than £30m in compensation and bolster similar claims lodged against the big UK supermarkets. The employment tribunal ruling will benefit 3,540 claimants, who accused Next of paying its retail sales staff – who are overwhelmingly female – lower". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
